2/ In a post yesterday, Microsoft's head of strategy for Windows 8, Mark Mullin, pointed out that AI could be a major player in the coming years.

3/ "I think we're going to see an increase in the number of people who are going to be able to play games, and we're going to see a reduction in the number of people who are going to be able to make games," he said. "In order to stay relevant, we need to build a platform that allows people to make games that are relevant to them."

4/ This is the first time Microsoft has made a formal announcement on AI.

5/ "I think there's a lot of interest in AI, and it's something that's going to be on the table for a long time," Mullin said. "We're trying to get the technology to work in the right way, and we're trying to make sure it's able to work for everyone, not just for the tech community."

6/ Microsoft has also announced that it will be adding a new "smart assistant" to the Windows 8 operating system.
